js.user
Class JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.Member

java.lang.Object
  js.Var.Member<java.lang.Object>
      js.core.JsObject.Member
          js.dom.DOM.CanvasRenderingContext2D.Prototype.Member
              js.user.JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.Member
Enclosing class:
JsCanvasRenderingContext2D
public static class JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.Member
extends DOM.CanvasRenderingContext2D.Prototype.Member

An opaque class representing members of its enclosing opaque type.

Note that, this class is opaque but its constructors are all internal. This class and the subclasses of this class are used to declare either opaque public instance fields of the opaque type Var.Member or the opaque public static fields of other opaque types while their constructors are used to define the fields inside opaque classes. Under either circumstance, the field names must be exactly same as the member names, as the opaque fields of opaque types are resolved by re-compilers directly based on the field names.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org
JavaScript:
Opaque types can be resolved but no class objects for them can be created in the target codes. Re-compilers must exit with error on operations accessing that kind of class objects. Re-compilers must resolve an opaque instance field declared by this class in Var.Member or its subclasses to the JavaScript identifier: 
q.m
where m is the identifier of the field name and q is the identifier resolved from the instance of the enclosing member. Re-compilers must resolve an opaque static field declared by this class in opaque types other than Var.Member and its subclasses to the JavaScript identifier: 
m
where m is the identifier of the field name. And re-compilers must report error on the access to opaque fields declared by this class under any other circumstances.

Field Detail

globalAlpha

public final Value.Number.Member globalAlpha

An opaque instance field defining a sub-member that is named by the name of this field, qualified by the current member instance of the field, and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object refers to a float value specifying the opacity of content drawn on the canvas. The range of values is between 0.0 (fully transparent) and 1.0 (no additional transparency). The default value for the property is 1.0.

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this instance field to the identifier of the field name appending to the identifier resolved from its qualifying member with a dot in between.

globalCompositeOperation

public final Value.String.Member globalCompositeOperation

An opaque instance field defining a sub-member that is named by the name of this field, qualified by the current member instance of the field, and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object refers to a string specifying how colors being drawn are combined (or "composited") with colors that already exist on the canvas. The following are the possible values and their meanings. The word source in the these values refers to the colors being drawn onto the canvas, and the word destination refers to the existing colors on the canvas. The default is JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.COMPOSITE_SOURCE_OVER.

  • JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.COMPOSITE_COPY
  • JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.COMPOSITE_DARKER
  • JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.COMPOSITE_DESTINATION_ATOP
  • JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.COMPOSITE_DESTINATION_IN
  • JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.COMPOSITE_DESTINATION_OUT
  • JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.COMPOSITE_DESTINATION_OVER
  • JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.COMPOSITE_LIGHTER
  • JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.COMPOSITE_SOURCE_ATOP
  • JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.COMPOSITE_SOURCE_IN
  • JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.COMPOSITE_SOURCE_OUT
  • JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.COMPOSITE_SOURCE_OVER
  • JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.COMPOSITE_XOR

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this instance field to the identifier of the field name appending to the identifier resolved from its qualifying member with a dot in between.

lineCap

public final Value.String.Member lineCap

An opaque instance field defining a sub-member that is named by the name of this field, qualified by the current member instance of the field, and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object refers to a string value specifying how lines should be terminated. It matters only when drawing wide lines. Legal values for the property are listed as follows. The default value is JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.LINECAP_BUTT.

  • JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.LINECAP_BUTT
  • JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.LINECAP_ROUND
  • JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.LINECAP_SQUARE

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this instance field to the identifier of the field name appending to the identifier resolved from its qualifying member with a dot in between.

lineJoin

public final Value.String.Member lineJoin

An opaque instance field defining a sub-member that is named by the name of this field, qualified by the current member instance of the field, and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object refers to a string value specifying how two lines are joined. Legal values are JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.LINEJOIN_ROUND, JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.LINEJOIN_BEVEL, and JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.LINEJOIN_MITER. The default is JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.LINEJOIN_MITER.

When a path includes vertices where line segments and/or curves meet, this property specifies how those vertices are drawn. The effect of this property is apparent only when drawing with wide lines.

The default value of the property is JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.LINEJOIN_MITER, which specifies that the outside edges of the two line segments are extended until they intersect. When two lines meet at an acute angle, mitered joins can become quite long. The JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.miterLimit property places an upper bound on the length of a miter. Beyond this limit, the miter is beveled off.

The value JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.LINEJOIN_ROUND specifies that the outside edges of the vertex should be joined with a filled arc whose diameter is equal to the width of the line.

The value JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.LINEJOIN_BEVEL specifies that the outside edges of the vertex should be joined with a filled triangle.

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this instance field to the identifier of the field name appending to the identifier resolved from its qualifying member with a dot in between.

lineWidth

public final Value.Number.Member lineWidth

An opaque instance field defining a sub-member that is named by the name of this field, qualified by the current member instance of the field, and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object refers to a float value specifying the line width for stroking (line drawing) operations. The default is 1.0, and this property must be greater than 0.0. Wide lines are centered over the path, with half of the line width on each side.

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this instance field to the identifier of the field name appending to the identifier resolved from its qualifying member with a dot in between.

miterLimit

public final Value.Number.Member miterLimit

An opaque instance field defining a sub-member that is named by the name of this field, qualified by the current member instance of the field, and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object refers to a float value specifying the maximum ratio of miter length to line width when the JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.lineJoin property is JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.LINEJOIN_MITER.

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this instance field to the identifier of the field name appending to the identifier resolved from its qualifying member with a dot in between.

shadowBlur

public final Value.Number.Member shadowBlur

An opaque instance field defining a sub-member that is named by the name of this field, qualified by the current member instance of the field, and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object refers to a float value specifying how much feathering shadows should have. The default is 0.

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this instance field to the identifier of the field name appending to the identifier resolved from its qualifying member with a dot in between.

shadowColor

public final Value.String.Member shadowColor

An opaque instance field defining a sub-member that is named by the name of this field, qualified by the current member instance of the field, and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object refers to a string value specifying the color of shadows as a CSS or web style string and may include an alpha component for transparency. The default is black.

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this instance field to the identifier of the field name appending to the identifier resolved from its qualifying member with a dot in between.

shadowOffsetX

public final Value.Number.Member shadowOffsetX

An opaque instance field defining a sub-member that is named by the name of this field, qualified by the current member instance of the field, and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object refers to a float value specifying the horizontal offset of the shadows. Larger values make the shadowed object appear to float higher above the background. The default is 0.

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this instance field to the identifier of the field name appending to the identifier resolved from its qualifying member with a dot in between.

shadowOffsetY

public final Value.Number.Member shadowOffsetY

An opaque instance field defining a sub-member that is named by the name of this field, qualified by the current member instance of the field, and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object refers to a float value specifying the vertical offset of the shadows. Larger values make the shadowed object appear to float higher above the background. The default is 0.

Since:
1.0

canvas

public final JsHTMLCanvasElement.Member canvas

An opaque instance field defining a sub-member that is named by the name of this field, qualified by the current member instance of the field, and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object is a read-only reference to the JsHTMLCanvasElement element upon which this context will draw.

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this instance field to the identifier of the field name appending to the identifier resolved from its qualifying member with a dot in between.

fillStyle

public final Value.Member<java.lang.Object> fillStyle

An opaque instance field defining a sub-member that is named by the name of this field, qualified by the current member instance of the field, and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object refers to the current color, pattern, or gradient used for filling paths. The property may be set to a string or to a JsCanvasGradient or JsCanvasPattern object. When set to a string, it is parsed as a CSS color value and used for solid fills. When set to a JsCanvasGradient or JsCanvasPattern object, fills are done using the specified gradient or pattern.

Since:
1.0
See Also:
JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.createLinearGradient(Number, Number, Number, Number), JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.createPattern(JsHTMLCanvasElement, String), JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.createPattern(JsHTMLImageElement, String), JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.createRadialGradient(Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number)
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this instance field to the identifier of the field name appending to the identifier resolved from its qualifying member with a dot in between.

strokeStyle

public final Value.Member<java.lang.Object> strokeStyle

An opaque instance field defining a sub-member that is named by the name of this field, qualified by the current member instance of the field, and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object refers to the color, pattern, or gradient used for stroking (drawing) paths. The property may be set to a string or to a JsCanvasGradient or JsCanvasPattern object. When set to a string, it is parsed as a CSS color value and used for solid fills. When set to a JsCanvasGradient or JsCanvasPattern object, fills are done using the specified gradient or pattern.

Since:
1.0
See Also:
JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.createLinearGradient(Number, Number, Number, Number), JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.createPattern(JsHTMLCanvasElement, String), JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.createPattern(JsHTMLImageElement, String), JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.createRadialGradient(Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number)
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this instance field to the identifier of the field name appending to the identifier resolved from its qualifying member with a dot in between.
Constructor Detail

JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.Member

public JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.Member(JsObject.Member q,
                                         Var.Mid mid)

Internally constructs a member based on a qualifying member.

This constructor is internal and only called inside of opaque or internal classes or class members.

Note that, this constructor is internal but its declaring class is opaque. This constructor is used to define opaque instance fields declared in the declaring class of this constructor itself or its subclasses. Under this circumstance, the field names must be exactly same as the member names, as the opaque instance fields of the opaque type Var.Member or its subclasses are resolved by re-compilers directly to their names appending to the name resolved from the specified qualifying member with a dot in between.

Parameters:
q - A qualifying member
mid - The ID of the member to construct
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must report error on the invocation to an internal constructor.

JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.Member

public JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.Member(Var.Mid mid)

Internally constructs a member without a qualifying member.

This constructor is internal and only called inside of opaque or internal classes or class members.

Note that, this constructor is internal but its declaring class is opaque. This constructor is used to define opaque static fields, declared in opaque types other than the declaring class of this constructor itself and its subclasses. Under this circumstance, the field names must be exactly same as the member names, as the opaque static fields of opaque types are generally resolved by re-compilers directly to identifiers of their names.

Parameters:
mid - The ID of the member to construct
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must report error on the invocation to an internal constructor.
